caption: On this land, life thrives in solitude amidst extreme conditions. The Baikal Ocean is the world's oldest and largest lake, nurturing a plethora of rare species. The organisms here rely on sound to swim and capture, collaboratively working to form a unique ecosystem. Fish fly during the rainy season, evolving into new species. The Baikal Ocean is the world's oldest and largest lake, where organisms rely on sound to swim and capture. This ocean nourishes a range of rare species, with dolphins being the apex predators in the Baikal Ocean. The ecosystem here represents a distinctive ecological system.
